question_sentence: Which player did the Jacksonville Jaguars select with No. 1 overall pick in this year’s NFL Draft?
evidence: He becomes the fourth quarterback taken in Round 1 in franchise history – joining Byron Leftwich (2003), Blaine Gabbert (2011) and Blake Bortles (2014) – but Lawrence is the first tabbed No. 1 overall.

question_sentence: A train overpass collapsed and led to the deaths of at least 24 people in which city?
evidence: The overpass collapsed late Monday, sending subway cars plunging from the city's newest subway line toward a busy boulevard. Rescuers brought in a crane to stabilize the wreckage so they could safely continue the operation.

question_sentence: Why did a photo of Joe and Jill Biden and Jimmy and Rosalynn Carter cause a stir on social media this week?
choices: The Bidens looked enormous next to the Carters
evidence: The use of the wide-angle lens could have helped create an illusion, according to camera company Canon. On images shot with a wide-angle lens, perspective appears to be exaggerated: Nearby objects may look much bigger (and hence nearer) than they really are, and faraway objects look smaller and further away.

question_sentence: A Florida student accused of rigging her high school’s homecoming election faces what punishment?
evidence: Emily Grover and her mother, Laura Carroll, assistant principal at Bellview Elementary School, were arrested in March after authorities said the duo used Carroll's special access to the district's student data system to cast hundreds of fraudulent votes for Grover in the homecoming queen election at Tate High School.

question_sentence: Which group received an increase in contributions from the Chinese diaspora before the Jan. 6 insurrection at the Capitol?
evidence: Their gifts made up more than 80% of the $106,107 raised for medical costs for members of the Proud Boys who were stabbed during violent clashes in Washington in mid-December.

question_sentence: Bill and Melinda Gates are divorcing after a 27-year marriage. Where did the couple meet?
evidence: Together for more than 27 years, the duo co-chaired the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, raised three children and spoke about their equal partnership leading to a lasting marriage.

question_sentence: The Facebook Oversight Board upheld the social network’s ban on Donald Trump and instructed the company to do what?
choices: Give Mark Zuckerberg the final say
Review the matter within six months
Reassess Facebook pages of left-leaning political figures
evidence: Members of the Oversight Board also made recommendations to guide Facebook’s policies when it comes to "serious risks of harm" from heads of state and other highly influential figures.

question_sentence: After being convicted of George Floyd’s murder, Derek Chauvin’s defense attorney requested a new trial citing
choices: Conflict of interest with the judge
evidence: Chauvin is scheduled to be sentenced in June. Minnesota's attorney general last week filed paperwork asking that Chauvin be given a more severe prison sentence in the case.

question_sentence: What percentage of American adults did President Biden want at least partially vaccinated by July 4?
evidence: About 56% of adults have received at least one shot.  The pace of vaccinations required to reach 70% is much slower than the speed with which the nation got to its current levels.

question_sentence: Peloton is recalling its treadmills. Which of these defects was the root of the recall?
evidence: Peloton has agreed to recall all of its treadmills and apologized for having fought the federal government's request to do so after the equipment came under scrutiny in the death of a 6-year-old child.

question_sentence: What is the name of the new Conservative MP for Hartlepool?
Navy gunboats were dispatched this week after French fishermen threatened to blockade a port in which parish of Jersey?
The UK cost of applying to legally change gender through a gender recognition certificate is being cut from £140 to how much?
Joe Biden has raised the annual cap on refugees allowed into the US from 15,000 to what?
A newly published tell-all diary by which senior EU figure describes the UK’s Brexit negotiating team as ‘childish’ and ‘not up to the task’?
Which Booker Prize-winning author has criticised the UK’s ‘tin-pot chumocratic government’ over a planned 50% funding cut to arts subjects at universities?
Which satirical political candidate ran for London mayor on a platform of ‘fiscal responsibility, social awareness and not being an anti-vaccine nutjob’?
At least 19 people have died in ongoing protests in which South American country over plans to raise taxes?
An internal war has erupted in which French political party over a local alliance formed with Emmanuel Macron’s En Marche ahead of council elections?
A proposed global waiver on Covid vaccine patents is being considered by members of which international body?
According to officials close to the decision, which Covid-19 vaccine is the FDA set to authorize next week for use in children and teens ages 12 to 15?
evidence: The FDA is reportedly set to authorize the use of the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine in children and teens ages 12 to 15, making the vaccine the first to be authorized on that young of an age group in the United States.

question_sentence: Bowing to pressure, the Biden administration reversed course to increase this year’s ceiling on how many refugees the US admits. What will the new cap be?
evidence: In line with a figure proposed in February, the White House will increase the cap to 62,500 refugees. This move follows blowback after the Biden administration initially announced plans to keep the annual refugee cap at 15,000, a carryover from the Trump administration.

question_sentence: Which philanthropic power couple informed the world via Twitter of their decision to end their marriage?
evidence: After 27 years of marriage, Bill and Melinda Gates announced their decision to divorce. According to the statement, the two will still work together in furthering the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, a philanthropic organization they founded in 2000 that has spent more than $53.8 billion worldwide on a range of initiatives related to global health.

question_sentence: Foreign ministers of the Group of Seven (G7) issued a joint statement warning China not to escalate tensions with which self-ruled island?
evidence: In reaction to an increase in Chinese military maneuvering, the G7 unanimously called on China not to escalate cross-strait tensions with Tawain, instead encouraging a “peaceful resolution of cross-Strait issues.”

question_sentence: Facebook’s independent Oversight Board made a ruling on the suspension of former President Donald Trump’s account over his incitement of the January 6th Capitol riots. What was the board’s conclusion on what the company should do with the account?
choices: unblock the account immediately, with limitations
uphold the suspension, but revisit the decision at a later date
evidence: The Oversight Board concluded that the company could keep blocking Trump from using the platform as his posts “created an environment where a serious risk of violence was possible,” but said it would need to revisit the decision in six months and “reexamine the arbitrary penalty it imposed on January 7 and decide the appropriate penalty.”

question_sentence: Both British and French naval vessels were deployed to help resolve a dispute at the self-governing isle of Jersey, located 14 miles off the coast of France. What was the dispute all about?
choices: a new Chunnel Tunnel starting point
ownership of an ocean taxi service
evidence: Described as “resolved for now,” the controversy revolves around a new mandate requiring French fisherman to prove they had been fishing in the waters for years to keep their operation going. The dispute was blamed as a consequence of a hastily negotiated post-Brexit deal between the UK and European Union.

question_sentence: Three people were killed as a boat carrying 32 people hit a reef and overturned. Near which US city did this happen?
evidence: The boat struck a reef just off San Diego, near Cabrillo National Monument in Point Loma. A US Customs and Border Protection agent said there was “every indication” that the boat was a smuggling vessel used to carry migrants looking to enter the United States illegally.

question_sentence: May 4th has become a culturally significant day for fans of which film franchise?
evidence: To fans worldwide, May 4th has become Star Wars Day, an informal holiday celebrating the “Star Wars” franchise. Greetings abound with “May the Fourth be with you” – a play on the famous film line: “May the Force be with you.”

question_sentence: Hip hop artist and fashion mogul Sean Combs announced that he’s once again made a move to change up his name. According to a post on his verified Instagram account, what’s Combs’ new middle name?
evidence: According to the post featuring his Florida driver’s license, Combs – who over time has been known as Puffy, Puff Daddy, P. Diddy and Diddy – is now Sean Love Combs. The caption read: “IT’S OFFICIAL!!! WELCOME TO THE LOVE ERA.”

question_sentence: Following a record-setting mission to the International Space Station, four astronauts successfully returned to Earth in a Crew Dragon capsule. Which private company is behind the mission?
evidence: The capsule was created by SpaceX as part of a public-private partnership with NASA. This mission specifically marks an end to the mission dubbed Crew-1, which set a record for the longest time in space – more than 5 months – by a crew that launched aboard an American-built spacecraft.
